data.text:
@cathocall @OengusWandering "An analysis of death data for Q4 2019 shows that the mean average number of days between the date of death and date of registration was 63 days while the median was 18 days."
https://t.co/2XKNynHxrg
@StuartDNeilson @OengusWandering I would like to see the time lag data please and thanks.

@cathocall @OengusWandering That IS the trend. The trend by epidemiological date and the trend by report date are almost identical, with a lag.
The "not all this month" is a distraction and an irrelevance, designed to replace the complete reported number with a (lower) incomplete count.

@OengusWandering @StuartDNeilson You are completely missing the point. Trends need to be measured against actual dates or they aren't a "trend". I'm not dodging reality, I just want the trend per month based on actual death and not its date of classification.

@cathocall @StuartDNeilson Swings and roundabouts. There are deaths in Feb that won't be reported for months yet, doesn't change the pattern. 

It's been this way since the start. A cynic might suggest it's a neat way of dodging reality, "oh many of those deaths happened MONTHS ago", on constant repeat.

@Kelfogarty The definition of underlying cause of death according to the World Health Organization (and used by the CSO) is "the disease or injury which initiated the train of events leading directly to death, or the circumstances of the accident or violence which produced the fatal injury."
@StuartDNeilson Am genuinely interested in classification. Someone I know died from cancer and had covid at end but death was inevitable. Is she classified as death from covid?
@StuartDNeilson Some of the reported deaths in February were older cases now being classified. Please provide this breakdown as well instead of just assuming they died in February.
@StuartDNeilson Thank you, Stuart. I've only ever looked at the hub on the phone - which is an off-putting experience. Much clearing on the laptop. Thanks.

@fionn_o_c Sorry, I usually remember to include the link and missed it today. These are the official reports from the government hub at:
https://t.co/iXdgS9vFUp
